name: Rocke
descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) is an alleged Chinese-speaking adversary whose primary objective appeared to be cryptojacking, or stealing victim system resources for the purposes of mining cryptocurrency. The name [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) comes from the email address "rocke@live.cn" used to create the wallet which held collected cryptocurrency. Researchers have detected overlaps between [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) and the Iron Cybercrime Group, though this attribution has not been confirmed.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Application Layer Protocol
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) issued wget requests from infected systems to the C2.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has executed wget and curl commands to Pastebin over the HTTPS protocol.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106)'s miner has created UPX-packed files in the Windows Start Menu Folder.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Boot or Logon Initialization Scripts
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has installed an "init.d" startup script to maintain persistence.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Unix Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) used shell scripts to run commands which would obtain persistence and execute the cryptocurrency mining malware.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used Python-based malware to install and spread their coinminer.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Systemd Service
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has installed a systemd service script to maintain persistence.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has extracted tar.gz files after downloading them from a C2 server.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) exploited Apache Struts, Oracle WebLogic (CVE-2017-10271), and Adobe ColdFusion (CVE-2017-3066) vulnerabilities to deliver malware.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)

subtechniques.name: Linux and Mac File and Directory Permissions Modification
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has changed file permissions of files so they could not be modified.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Files and Directories
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) downloaded a file "libprocesshider", which could hide files on the target system.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)

subtechniques.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has modified /etc/ld.so.preload to hook libc functions in order to hide the installed dropper and mining software in process lists.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) used scripts which detected and uninstalled antivirus software.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify System Firewall
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) used scripts which killed processes and added firewall rules to block traffic related to other cryptominers.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Clear Linux or Mac System Logs
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has cleared log files within the /var/log/ folder.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has deleted files on infected machines.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Timestomp
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has changed the time stamp of certain files.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) used malware to download additional malicious files to the target system.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used shell scripts which download mining executables and saves them with the filename "java".(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Network Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) conducted scanning for exposed TCP port 7001 as well as SSH and Redis servers.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Standard Port
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106)'s miner connects to a C2 server using port 51640.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has modified UPX headers after packing files to break unpackers.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Software Packing
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106)'s miner has created UPX-packed files in the Windows Start Menu Folder.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Compile After Delivery
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has compiled malware, delivered to victims as .c files, with the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC).(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) can detect a running process's PID on the infected machine.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Portable Executable Injection
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106)'s miner, "TermsHost.exe", evaded defenses by injecting itself into Windows processes, including Notepad.exe.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: SSH
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has spread its coinminer via SSH.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has looked for IP addresses in the known_hosts file on the infected system and attempted to SSH into them.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Compute Hijacking
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has distributed cryptomining malware.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Rootkit
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has modified /etc/ld.so.preload to hook libc functions in order to hide the installed dropper and mining software in process lists.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Cron
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) installed a cron job that downloaded and executed files from the C2.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Security Software Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) used scripts which detected and uninstalled antivirus software.(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)(Citation: Unit 42 Rocke January 2019)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used uname -m to collect the name and information about the infected system's kernel.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

subtechniques.name: Private Keys
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used SSH private keys on the infected machine to spread its coinminer throughout a network.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Web Service
technique_table_data.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used Pastebin, Gitee, and GitLab for Command and Control.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)(Citation: Talos Rocke August 2018)

subtechniques.name: Dead Drop Resolver
subtechniques.descr: [Rocke](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0106) has used Pastebin to check the version of beaconing malware and redirect to another Pastebin hosting updated malware.(Citation: Anomali Rocke March 2019)

Talos Rocke August 2018.description: Liebenberg, D.. (2018, August 30). Rocke: The Champion of Monero Miners. Retrieved May 26, 2020.

Unit 42 Rocke January 2019.description: Xingyu, J.. (2019, January 17). Malware Used by Rocke Group Evolves to Evade Detection by Cloud Security Products. Retrieved May 26, 2020.

Anomali Rocke March 2019.description: Anomali Labs. (2019, March 15). Rocke Evolves Its Arsenal With a New Malware Family Written in Golang. Retrieved April 24, 2019.
